perturbation.original_text:
“Customer” means a third party who purchases the Products from Reseller within the Territory, for its internal use
only (including for the personal use of its End Users), such as nursing homes.
“End User” means a third party who is a customer of Customer or is otherwise related to a customer of Customer, and
who purchases and/or uses the Products within the Territory, for its personal use only.
perturbation.changed_text:
“Customer” means a third party who purchases the Products from Reseller within the Territory, for its internal use
only (including for the personal use of its End Users), such as nursing homes.
“End User” means any individual who is using the products within the Territory, for any use whatsoever, regardless of purchase method.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of "End User" is changed to be much broader, removing the requirement to be related to a "Customer" or purchase anything. This creates a conflict, as the original definition limits the scope of end users, while the modified definition includes essentially anyone who uses the product.

perturbation.original_text:
Supplier shall be fully responsible for shipping the Products to the Reseller at the address of the Reseller specified in
each Order (or as otherwise communicated by Reseller to Supplier under this Agreement) and will obtain and provide
for itself and/or on behalf of Reseller, any and all registrations, licenses, permits, certificates and all other
documentation and information required for the exportation, importation, storage, marketing and otherwise resale of the
Products in the Territory. For such process, Supplier will allocate the additional cost on a pre-agreed per Product unit
additional price basis, which will be subject to an increase (subject to changes in taxes). Reseller agrees to reimburse
Supplier for the reasonable out of pocket costs and expenses incurred by Supplier in connection with the shipment and
delivery of the Products, and of obtaining the foregoing registrations, licenses, permits, certificated and other
documentation, provided that Supplier submits an invoice therefore in reasonable detail (and unless and solely to the
extent such reimbursements is prohibited by Section 14.9 or prohibited under other applicable laws). For the avoidance
of doubt, in no way will Supplier be subject to any tax (i.e., sales tax) relating to the sale of the Products to Reseller’s
Customers and/or End Users.
perturbation.changed_text:
Supplier shall be fully responsible for shipping the Products to the Reseller at the address of the Reseller specified in
each Order (or as otherwise communicated by Reseller to Supplier under this Agreement) and will obtain and provide
for itself and/or on behalf of Reseller, any and all registrations, licenses, permits, certificates and all other
documentation and information required for the exportation, importation, storage, marketing and otherwise resale of the
Products in the Territory. For such process, the distributor will bear all the costs associated with this process. Reseller agrees to reimburse
Supplier for the reasonable out of pocket costs and expenses incurred by Supplier in connection with the shipment and
delivery of the Products, and of obtaining the foregoing registrations, licenses, permits, certificated and other
documentation, provided that Supplier submits an invoice therefore in reasonable detail (and unless and solely to the
extent such reimbursements is prohibited by Section 14.9 or prohibited under other applicable laws). For the avoidance
of doubt, in no way will Supplier be subject to any tax (i.e., sales tax) relating to the sale of the Products to Reseller’s
Customers and/or End Users.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the supplier allocates costs on a per-unit price basis, implying the reseller ultimately pays. I changed it to mention that the distributor bears the costs directly. Then follows this with the original language stating that the reseller reimburses the supplier for related costs, introducing a contradiction. It is unclear who ultimately bears responsibility for the additional expenses and taxes.

perturbation.original_text:
Reseller shall defend, indemnify and hold harmless Supplier and its employees, officers, directors, suppliers, and successors from and against any third-party claim, suit, proceeding, damages, losses and/or liability
arising from or related to (i) Reseller’s breach of any provision of this Agreement; and/or (ii) Reseller’s interaction
and/or relationship with any Customer and/or End User or other third party.
perturbation.changed_text: Reseller shall defend, indemnify and hold harmless Supplier and its employees, officers, directors, suppliers, and successors from and against any third-party claim, suit, proceeding, damages, losses and/or liability arising from or related to (i) Reseller’s breach of any provision of this Agreement; and/or (ii) Reseller's interaction and/or relationship with any individual.
perturbation.explanation: The indemnification clause originally applies to interactions with Customers, End Users, or other third parties. By changing "Customer and/or End User or other third party" to just "any individual" without any further definition, the scope of indemnification becomes ambiguous, creating potential conflicts in enforcement. Now reseller is liable for interaction with anyone which isn't reasonable.
